abstract_summ: Uncertainty of input parameters in crop models and high costs of their experimental evaluation provide an exciting opportunity for sensitivity analysis, which allows identifying the most significant parameters for different crops.A comparative evaluation of GQI models revealed that the FGQI model predicts groundwater quality better than the conventional GQI-10 and GQI-7 models.With SWAT model performance, SWAT calibration and uncertainty analysis programs (CUP) was used for sensitive analysis of SWAT parameters on flow discharge and sediment load simulation.In this study, a comprehensive analysis of ammonia emission estimations is accomplished at both temporal (1980-2016) and spatial (provincial) scales using a mass-balanced model, and emission projections through 2030 are also studied in different development scenarios.We identify soil indicators that play an essential role in crop yield productivity and show that their influence is the highest in the topsoil layer.
title_summ: Ecohydrogeochemical functioning of coastal freshwater herbaceous wetlands in the Protected Natural Area, Ciénaga del Fuerte (American tropics): Spatiotemporal behaviourSensitivity Analysis of Soil Parameters in Crop Model Supported with High-Throughput ComputingAssessing groundwater quality for drinking water supply using hybrid fuzzy-GIS-based water quality index.Sub-basin prioritization for assessment of soil erosion susceptibility in Kangsabati, a plateau basin: A comparison between MCDM and SWAT modelsBioenergy in China: Evaluation of domestic biomass resources and the associated greenhouse gas mitigation potentialsAssessment of Factors Affecting Fish Production and Marketing in Gambella Region, EthiopiaGreening and legume-supported crop rotations: An impacts assessment on Italian arable farms.A temporal-spatial analysis and future trends of ammonia emissions in China.Identification of irrigation potential areas, using multi-criteria analysis in Khyber District, Pakistan.
title_abstract_phrases: Assessing groundwater quality for drinking water supply using hybrid fuzzy-GIS-based water quality index.Sensitivity Analysis of Soil Parameters in Crop Model Supported with High-Throughput ComputingUncertainty of input parameters in crop models and high costs of their experimental evaluation provide an exciting opportunity for sensitivity analysis, which allows identifying the most significant parameters for different crops.A comparative evaluation of GQI models revealed that the FGQI model predicts groundwater quality better than the conventional GQI-10 and GQI-7 models.With SWAT model performance, SWAT calibration and uncertainty analysis programs (CUP) was used for sensitive analysis of SWAT parameters on flow discharge and sediment load simulation.Yet, the legume-supported crop rotations determine a reduction in the production of main crops and, especially in some areas, negative economic and social impacts.
